about:
Hi, my name is Viktor Shevchenko. I am a frontend developer from Kyiv, Ukraine. I am 31, married, have a daughter.

I have started my professional career in 2006 with a biggest telecom operator in Ukraine(Kyivstar) as a consultant and later as a mobile network engineer. In 2010 I have switched to fronted development area. Firstly as a freelancer, later as an employee.

I have made my path from web developer to a team leader. Played a key role in project architecture development, built applications from scratch, transformed legacy applications to be SPA, managed a team up to 5 persons, adopted Scrum methodology.  

Presently, I am a team lead in GlobalLogic Ukraine(IT outsourcing company, headquartered in USA). Beside my primary project duties I do participate in different internal activities like consulting on account launching, pre-sale activities, interviewing candidates, and mentoring JavaScript in training center.

I am a kind of person, with a big desire to learn new information and share it, so I am always glad to accept challenges (both in my life, career and daily work). In software development I value quality over quantity. In technologies, I am using, I prefer to understand how they work on a low level, this helps me to use them with a maximum efficiency. I have solid knowledge of core and advanced Javascript, modern UI frameworks and related technologies.

I do open source contribution by authoring and maintaning a library called [reactive-mobx-form](https://github.com/vict-shevchenko/reactive-mobx-form) that is aimed to simplify work with web forms in React MobX applications. And contributing to validation library [validatorjs](https://github.com/skaterdav85/validatorjs).

Beside of programming I like traveling, active sports(snowboarding), mixing of cocktails.

Experience with NodeJS, beginner in Python, did some PHP in past, participated in Clojure contest

I have experience in project management for 2 teams

MongoDB, MySQL

Git, GitHub, Perforce, SVN, Docker, Atlassian stack, WebStorm, VS Code
